Reviews.Title: Great in the beginning but now have major issues.
Reviews.Author: P. DeFranco "Philly50"
Reviews.Content: I really wanted this system to work.  I read all of the reviews and everything seemed great accept for the wireless range.  After setting up the system (w/additions camera), all looked great.  Setup was easy and directions were clear.  The night viewing range was good and the reception range was better than I expected.  Initially I was very happy, but after a few days of use I noticed issues with the picture.  One camera showed a clear picture while the over was almost completely washed out and at night showed very blurry.  And a day after rain or snow, both camera were fogged for a few days.  No big deal I thought, I just have a defective camera(s).  Unfortunately after replacing the one bad camera, the second camera was now washed out and barely visible.  So I figure lets give it one last try and replace the second camera and LCD receiver.  Again, same issues.  Bad picture on one camera and perfect picture on the other.  I finally gave up and returned everything to amazon.  Now I'm back to square one.

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: B. Van
Reviews.Content: So far everything works well. I opened up the box and plugged in the camera. I then walked all the way around my house and it worked well. Yes there was a little fuz and static but nothing major. My main concerns were that my existing wireless devices would interfear. (Wireless internet, Wireless phones 6.0 Panasonic, and a wireless video transmiter 5.8) So far nothing seems to be interfearing with this camera. The picture quality is good and it seems to be well built.I read the reviws for the other SVAT camera system that says you have to plug in the monitor behind the batteries and that it uses AAA Batteries. I thought I would try this camera because it has a rechargable batery and a base that you can set the monitor in while it charges.I am very happy with my purchase. My expectations were really high but this thing does work well. So that is why I am taking the time to type this review so others can rest assured that this camera is,in my opnion a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Can't hide outside!
Reviews.Author: PaulB "PaulB"
Reviews.Content: Update: March 2011 - This was a great product while it lasted.  16 months after purchase, the Camera went dead.  It was great while we had it, but the camera seems to be sensitive to humidity and outside temperatures.We bought this for one specific purpose.  To see who is at the front door.  Our porch is situated such that you can not see who is at the door from any window.Our other Electronic Devices:  Wireless Internet and Cordless Phones.  No issues with the camera/monitor or our other devices.  Both the wireless and phones are 5.8Mhz which may be the reason we had no issue.Setup:  I had the camera on a nail above the door in 5 minutes.  Briefly skimmed the manual and we were off.  We tested for a couple of weeks both in daylight and night to get the placement right.  Note:  If you are buying strictly for night vision...don't.  It doesn't work more than a couple of feet. Our porch has a motion detection light in the ceiling so this works perfectly with the camera.  We have tried the monitor sitting in the cradle, walking around the house and connected to the tv.Results:  On our first test, my wife loved it.  She was able to clearly see who was knocking.  The range is pretty small and it does degrade rapidly with walls and doors between.  Our setup is basically 20 feet from the camera through the front door and outside wall.  Moving to a back room with 2 inside walls produced quite a bit of interference...we could see but the image would flake out every few seconds.  We also do not use the sound activation since the camera is outside it picks up any noise on the lowest settings...For the price and ease of use...it fits our needs perfectly.  It really depends on how you plan to use it, if it will work for you or not.  If you need long range or strict night vision...this is definately not the system for you.

Reviews.Title: Poor battery life
Reviews.Author: McLean, VA
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because it stated you can use a 9 volt battery.  After installing it and being excited with good range and good quality picture, I was diappointed that the battery died in 4 hours.  I replaced the battery thinking I had an old 9 volt and it died again!  I emailed the company and they stated that it was functioning as designed and the battery life was only for a maximum of four hours.  Because I did not want to drill a hole through my brick exterior to have the AC adaptor plugged inside (I was using this as a front entrance camera), I had to return the camera.  If you have an easy means to plug in the AC adaptor, I would recommend the camera.  It was small and discreet and the picture quality was fairly good.

Reviews.Title: Simple and Good Value
Reviews.Author: DaveM
Reviews.Content: I selected this system as it operates at 900 mhz frequency to avoid interference with the WiFi internet at the house and the wireless alarm sensors.  After charging the monitor for a few hours, I powered up the camera and it works fine.  Good wall penetration with this system - I have walked around 90 feet from the camera with the monitor and the picture is still viewable.  The audio is pretty sensitive as well.  The night vision is adequate for a short distance, probably 10 - 15 feet in total darkness maximum - fine if you have the camera mounted near the door and want to see who is there.  The night vision range could be further extended with the use of an additional infrared illuminator, however the resolution of the camera is not really adequate for a distance shot.  The camera is housed in a metal enclosure and seems high quality.  The handheld monitor unit is plastic and acceptable quality.  The built in lithium battery does not seem to be user-replaceable.  I have not opened the device to see if it is soldered into  place, but I suspect that it could be changed with a little tech savvy.  The unit will probably operate from the supplied ac adaptor even after the battery fails.  Overall, the system is a bargain and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Pleased !
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Early "View needed"
Reviews.Content: We use the product with 2 cameras.  We needed something that would allow us to have some visibility of the front door and driveway when we were in a location of the house without front windows.  This product allows us to quickly and easily view without going to the front of the house.  If exterior lights are on the night view is pretty good, otherwise it is about 8 to 10 feet from the camera with the night vision.  We have the monitor set up to the TV to enlarge the view.  Based on weather and other external factors the picture may be fuzzy at times...but definately clear enough for what view is needed. We are very pleased with the purchase and would recomend.

Reviews.Title: wow blows away summers baby monitor
Reviews.Author: whatthe... "dogsandcats"
Reviews.Content: i will post pics later but my god...the clarity is amazing and its wireless...how i really saw the clarity was i plugged it into a tv set on the kitchen counter and the pic was like a camcorder recording...im dead serious, i truly cant believe the reception...buy buy buy this camera instead of that summer brand from T... we have that one and this blows it away...real person real nieces and nephews real wireless monitor...

Reviews.Title: Save Your Money
Reviews.Author: Techster "Dave"
Reviews.Content: Color image only if you are next to the camera.  Lots of static even 20 feet away.  All that Clear Signal Technology seems to be marketing puffery.  Sound is non-existent.  Placing the monitor next to the camera should create a screeching feedback loop -- nothing.Also, I bought the product to be able to leave it active and recording 24/7.  The instructions say that it is bad to leave the monitor unit plugged in and running for extended periods.  Sort of defeats the purpose of getting it.  Trying to get clarification from the company gave me conflicting answers from the different people with whom I spoke.  Bottom line is that if you keep it running 24/7 you will cause your unit to run hot and will shorten the life of your battery.  (Assuming those answers were correct...)Warranty return policy for suspected bad merchandise is very constrictive and if they claim the device is good you have to pay $50 (on top of your shipping costs) if you want to get your hardware back.  It is almost better to buy another camera to see if the camera is bad but then maybe the monitor is bad and you've put more money into a system that still does not work.  I've switched to another product and am much happier.

Reviews.Title: Excellent baby monitor
Reviews.Author: K. Anderson "Love for nonfiction"
Reviews.Content: I am reviewing this as a baby video monitor - the price point is just higher than the junk you can buy at any "Babies" store and this blows those away.  Range is fine - I can ride the mower and see upstairs. We have used this for 10 months every night and it is still working fine.  The second camera is useful when traveling as we can clip it anywhere (we bought digital camera clip from Wolf Camera).  This is the best "baby" purchase so far. If you are trying to use this as a security camera and are unsatisfied, invest in a real security system.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Product
Reviews.Author: kjensmo "kjensmo"
Reviews.Content: This product is great. I am using it for security in my hair salon. It works great to keep an eye on the front while I am in a different area. It was easy to set up and it does exactly what I needed it to do.

Reviews.Title: works good, defender, phoenix1
Reviews.Author: George C. Hall
Reviews.Content: I got this system to use as a back up camera on my camp trailer, seamed like a versitile 110vac/battery operated unit, and with remoat moniter, and wireless, has been perfect, bought a 2nd cam to put on front of trailer, and its not only good security, but have got to watch wildlife in camp also. Ha I know this is a kind of off the wall use for this system, but why not? and it works. The only down side #1 it is not rain proof.  #2 the IR light source is pretty weak, 6-8 foot only, so night use is limited.  #3 A bubble and foil insulation can defeat the wireless signal(metal trailer skin, then this type of insulation), so have to watch placment.  #4 2nd cam was not as good as 1st one, so quality varys, by unit. I have not had any dealings with company so not sure how customer orented they are. Yes I would buy this system agin, cant beat it for the $, or versatility.The cams are small, and used in its intended application it is great. thank you George C. Hall

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected
Reviews.Author: S. A. McNeil
Reviews.Content: We bought this product because we have a solid steel door with no peep hole so we couldn't see outside.  It works better than I expected when I bought it. We can almost walk around our entire house with it outside.  We get some static in the back bedroom but that's not a big deal.  The sound is really good and I like the fact that you can adjust the sensitivity.  I would definitely recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Defender Phoenix 1
Reviews.Author: Leave me alone!!!!
Reviews.Content: I rarely write a negative review but this warrants it. Unless you are looking for a glorified baby monitor do not waste you time and money!Product FeaturesAvoid Interference & Interception with Clear Signal Technology - This system transmits over a 900mHz frequency - No Clear Signal here. Picked up every baby monitor in the areaCompletely Wire Free Surveillance - Both the monitor and camera can run on battery power, with no need for wires - Mostly wire free. Try the wire free power alternative 1 9 volt battery. Lasts 4 hours...What?! yep that's practical. Corded adapters are very cheaply made.Continuous Security Day or Night! - The camera comes equipped with infrared night vision - Good for about 5 ft from cameraDurable Camera for Indoor or Outdoor Use - The discreet camera is built with durable aluminum - This is a good one. Buried on the Defender website under additional notes .3 "Not for use in direct exposure to water, rain and snow". Called tech support for clarification. I got maybe, should work, kind of, put a plastic shopping bag over it and this is a topper use a bird house. Wow that builds confidence. Not sure about others view but outdoor typically means it will get wet. Interestingly enough all the products are their website that say weather resistance or even weather proof have the same disclaimer. This is very telling to me about the practices of Defender.Audio Support - A built-in microphone that lets you hear everything that's happening in your monitoring location - Garbled, static not very effective.Defender site: Audio and video signals are both able to pass through floors and walls within the 75 foot optimum range.Maybe if you live in a paper house. The only way I could get it to work is if the cameras were in direct line of site with the receiver.Bought a second camera from another seller and it performed just a bad.Poor craftsmanship - Out of the box, cheap plastic rattled, poor resolutionPoor customer service - Shoptronics/ Defender seller Uninformed, not technical, terrible call support, multiple calls, in queue for 15 seconds then dumped into voice mail with no call backs. BTW 4 weeks to process refund if it qualifies and being tested. I get checking the product but wow lack of service for me.Aside from this product I would not do business with DefenderWhat more can I say. After you buy a second camera with all the hassles, buy the Lorex Live Sd7 or 9. Good reviews, more robust product and better customer service. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy This II
Reviews.Author: J. Morgan "treasure books"
Reviews.Content: I should have listened to whoever wrote "Don't Buy This."  I am returning it and I have not used it, so nothing I have to say will deal with operation.1.  The camera may be "outdoor" but the wiring is not.  It has the same kind of D/C adapter plug as the indoor monitor.2.  The description said, "Use the battery option for complete portability!"  The battery option consists of a 6" wire with a D/C plug on one end and a 9V battery receiver on the other.  That  means that the battery just dangles.  There is no place to put it-----masking tape?  And this works outside?  I doubt it.3.  The handheld monitor is huge.  5 1/2" long + 2" antenna, 3 1/2" wide and almost 1" thick.  No stand or clip.  All buttons are on the front.4.  Despite the size of the handheld unit, the screen size is only 1 3/4" wide by 1 3/8".I measured all this with a tape measure and have tried to be accurate.  These details are things I wish I had known before I ordered.  I hope it helps someone.

Reviews.Title: Interference and Plenty of Static
Reviews.Author: Daniel Sauer "Never let em see you sweat!"
Reviews.Content: Tried it for a few days. When the camera was placed outside in near total darkness the LCD monitor slowly faded to a barely visible circle. However, it seemed to work fairly well inside, you have to constantly turn the LCD monitor to get the best picture or you're going to get a lot of screen noise and static.One very disturbing problem, we where able to watch the neighbors baby sleeping in her crib on the LCD monitor. The neighbors house is approx. 50 feet away from our home. At first we thought it was some sort of test picture, my daughter suggested a ghost! ;) It was creepy, and frankly having the ability to use the LCD monitor in this capacity is extremely disconcerting to me as a parent, clearly, interference with other monitoring devices is very likely to occur.

Reviews.Title: It Helped me keep my husband safe.
Reviews.Author: L. Fort
Reviews.Content: While my husband was ill with dementia he needed constant supervision. As I also needed to take care of our home and myself I had great peace of mind knowing that I could keep the hand held moniter with me at all times so I always knew how he was doing. I highley recomend the Defender Phoenix 1, wireless video camera.

Reviews.Title: OK, but camera fogs up at times
Reviews.Author: Retired Lt "Retired LT"
Reviews.Content: I've had this for about a month now. Setup was easy enough and worked great at first. Now we just started the Winter season, with rain that turns to snow and then back to rain again. The camera got foggy a few times. I unpluged the camara for about a half hour and it seemed to help clear it up...but have to do this every once in a while. So be aware the weather does seem to effect the camera. I'm going to keep this unit, because I can put up with the short falls of it. I use it to view my driveway from my living room, so I can see any vistors arriving before the doorbell rings. I would recommend this to others, but want them to know the camara is effected by wet weather. Thank you

Reviews.Title: Great product, but...
Reviews.Author: D. Watkins
Reviews.Content: Unit works as advertised.  Easy to install and great picture.  However, strongly recommend using AC adapter on the cameras as battery only lasts 3 hours.  I went through 2 batteries thinking unit was faulty, but customer service confirmed working as expected.

Reviews.Title: No Good for Multiple Cameras
Reviews.Author: M. Gentry "Mike n DFW"
Reviews.Content: I had actually made the mistake of ordering the additional camera first. =) Lot of good that did so I then ordered the main unit with camera, got it all set up and got ready to try it out but, wow! It really is wireless, I guess I'm spoiled having only ever dealt with the old standard wired security cameras and there is a world of quality difference between the two. The snow on this system is incredible, the unit's description clearly shows images of the cameras being mounted on brick exterior walls, well, good luck getting reception with that.Indoors the quality was almost bearable unfortunately that was of no use for me.The system is suppose to utilize 2 cameras and with the hand held base/monitor it alternates between the cameras, even with every possible configuration imaginable I can get either one camera to work but, never both. They're both broadcasting but, I get one image then snow, move the monitor around and maybe get the other camera's image then lose the first camera's image.It's like chasing your tail. I even stood in direct sight of both cameras outside and it still looks like a blizzard.I can see this system possibly working for a baby camera, indoors, things might work out for you. Make sure the base unit isn't far from the camera and, avoid being suckered into adding a second camera. This system is lucky to work with the one camera, the two camera feature should have been scratched.For the cost, you can easily purchase the old standard wired camera (network or coax), granted you have to run the wire and power but if your security is really your concern, you'll find it easily worth the effort. Wireless is cute and easy, if that's really all you want then you might be fine. For all others though, avoid this setup.I've returned this system for refund. My next attempt will be a wired network setup.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy as a baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Randal "digitas"
Reviews.Content: This is listed as a result for baby monitors, but it doesn't work at all for that:1. It is WAY WAY WAY too quiet. If you think you are going to be able to hear your kids in the other room, maybe you will with the volume all the way up and holding the monitor next to your ear, but it won't alert you or wake you up.2. You can't use any other baby monitors at the same time as this or the video gets all screwy and the audio is all fuzz.

Reviews.Title: Not a quality item.  STAY AWAY.
Reviews.Author: amberdallas33
Reviews.Content: I purchased this, like many others, as a baby monitor.  The camera seemed to perform well, although the range was pretty weak.  But the receiver was a piece of junk.  The battery wouldn't hold a charge, so unless the thing was plugged in it was useless, and the connector was touchy so I couldn't even touch it.  It didn't interfere with my wireless internet, but it was pretty worthless.  I returned it as a defective item, and bought the uniden UDW10003.  It is FAR superior, and I am headed to that product's page to offer a glowing review.  This product is actually worse than many baby monitors.  BUY THE UNIDEN!.

Reviews.Title: customer review
Reviews.Author: pyrojoe711
Reviews.Content: This is a great entry level system for those needing room monitoring. The wireless handheld monitor is cool.We are pleased with everything except battery life. You will be lucky to get 2  hours max. DC power adapter are included along with a charging base.Make sure that you have a 110 v outlet near for power for the camera and all is well. A real cool feature is that you can add additional cameras with ease.

Reviews.Title: It doesn't work like I expected.
Reviews.Author: Bruce Holms
Reviews.Content: I expected that it would have clear bright color picture. It did for about 5 days - then the picture got dimmer and dimmer. I don't know what happened - but I returned it.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this device
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: The battery lasted a few months and now I have to leave the monitor plugged into the wall.  The battery will not charge.  I contacted the company and after some negotiating they agreed to sell me a new battery for $25.  They sent me a USED battery that again doesn't hold a charge.  I don't recommend anyone buy this product.

Reviews.Title: Not as expected
Reviews.Author: Jude
Reviews.Content: This outdoor camera was not as useful as I expected.  The image is not of the best quality and in trying to mount and adjust it, the antenna which is just a piece of very thin plastic coated wire, broke off.  While trying to adjust the camera on the "base", it came loose from the base and I couldn't get it back together.  It would be good for a front or back door entrance with lighting, but not that great in unlighted areas.  It is also a decent camera for monitoring a sleeping baby or child.  The signal for sudden sound seems to work fine and can be adjusted.  On the positive side, I did contact the company about my problems with the antenna and the base and they sent me a new camera at no charge so I would rate the customer service as great.

Reviews.Title: Great idea bad execution
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Mills "C Mills"
Reviews.Content: I wanted this for trying to catch our neighbors doing things in our yard but it is worthless at night.  It has a light that pitifully tries to capture night vision but if it is more than a few feet out, don't count on seeing it.  Although it wasn't its intended use... we use it now in our back yard to watch the kids playing and making sure they aren't getting into too much trouble.  We have alot of issues with interference, we have alot of electronics in the house but no more than others.  it would be nice to have a stand for it because instead of mounting the camera, we move it around depending on what room we are in so we can see the kids.  Some of the baby monitors I have seen do a better job of what we are using it for.

Reviews.Title: Poor Reception
Reviews.Author: Brian D. Lumpkin
Reviews.Content: When I ordered this, I ordered it because of the good reviews.  My wife and I were planning on using it for a baby monitor.  We live in a 2 story older house.  Not very big, but our daughters room is on the second floor.  When the monitor is in the same room it was awesome.  Very clear crisp picture and radiant color.  However, once we moved more than 3 feet out of the room, the sound quality was very staticy and garbled and the video would come and go quality wise.  The video was very unreliable and the static made it even harder to hear in the room.  I wouldn't suggest this product to anyone for monitoring purposes.  I think the product would be great in a wired circuit security function, but not wireless.

Reviews.Title: Solves the problem, but limited range on wireless
Reviews.Author: Firebird "Firebird93"
Reviews.Content: We have a beautiful custom iron front door that doesn't lend itself to a peephole so this device is ideal.  Works fine but as some others have mentioned range is quite limited.  Static starts to crop up once we're more than about 15' from the front door - unfortunately this eliminates any ideas of bringing it to the backyard with us.  We are using it in a suburban neighborhood that has about 50' between homes - so not sure that the interference theory mentioned elsewhere is the issue.  Range aside it does do the job fine - the screen and colors are plenty clear to recognize who is at the door.  I really like that it has a charging base to set it on.  My only other (minor) complaint is that it's not totally clear when the motion/sound sensing beeps are on or off, and car noise from a car driving by will cause it to beep if on.

Reviews.Title: Poor reception, low resolution, low quality build
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Birge
Reviews.Content: The comments on the poor range are generally true. What people aren't saying is that the second you get this thing even a room away, the quality degrades and static comes in, even if it's still "in range." I also find that the screen "flashes" sometimes, even if the reception is relatively good. And good is a relative concept here, because even with perfect reception the video quality is so poor that you can barely tell who is who. It's sufficient to tell if your baby is awake, but not that it's actually your baby, for example...The quality of the receiver is very low. It is cheap and put together like a toy, not a piece of equipment. It makes annoying beeps whenever you turn it on or use a function, and its alarm setting wheel is so cheap that it will constantly get turned up as you hold it.Having said that, for the price it's possibly worth the money if you have very modest expectations for it.

Reviews.Title: Phoenix1 DLH Review
Reviews.Author: Darren L. Horton "sight challenged"
Reviews.Content: 3 STARS:  The Phoenix 1 is a good camera and monitor.  The ONLY complaint I have, and it seems to be true with everything is; The indoor range is dramatically overstated.  I currently have the camera inside my house at my front door.  The monitor is 20 feet away next to my Television.  There is a wall blocking a "direct line of sight" by nevertheless it is only 20 feet away and the reception is affected pretty bad.  Other than that, especially with no blockage it works very good.  The microphone picks up well too.

Reviews.Title: Not for apartment use
Reviews.Author: Ken C.
Reviews.Content: The product was easy to set up and we are using it as a baby monitor.  It gets the job done and we can see and monitor our son, but the picture is very very snowy.  We called tech support and they told us it is because we live in an apartment building where we have interference from all sorts of electronic devices from our neighbors and they recommended we return it.  It will cost more than we would like to return it, so we are trying to put up with the snowy reception.  Like I said, at least it gets the job done.

Reviews.Title: Baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Jason J. Kinlaw
Reviews.Content: I bought this product just to use as a baby monitor and it has worked great.  When she cries i can hear her and at night when it is dark i can see her just fine.  I would recommend this for everyone.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for what I needed!
Reviews.Author: Racheal Harmon "CEOofthishouse"
Reviews.Content: I have a bi-level home with no windows downstairs. When people come over I can not see that they are here nor can I here them when they knock, This system is so perfect! It has a motion sensor so that when people pull in my drive way or walk up to my door it beeps. It has sound although the sound picks up everything including the wind. The camera was so easy to install and so small that people can't see it. It has night vision that isn't wonderful but it works!! The monitor is wireless and has a great picture.I am very happy with the product! I can monitor the front of my home, and with they system being wireless I can take it with me upstairs and into the backyard!Great buy and for the price it is more than worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: Great product..at last, a camera that works
Reviews.Author: John Smith "John"
Reviews.Content: we have 3 babies and we were looking everywhere for a good,reliable video monitor with several cameras. we knew by experience that the kid's stuff does not work great,so we switched to "real" security system, and this model did the trick just fine. It was our second try, but the first model had too much interference to work properly (ah this annoying blip, blip in the middle of the night...)Easy to use, no unnecessary gadget or design...we like particularly this model because of the automated switch to night vision in the evenings. just one comment:it is a shame that the model does not allow for a third camera for our third kid. All-in,great device and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: roaddog
Reviews.Content: I have done a lot of looking for a cheap security camra and this is the one. has good reviews for one, and easy to use. if your looking for a good product this is it . i have two cams and it works great. i didnt no it came with a two camra box so i order a extra cam. so if you want two camras its here.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price.
Reviews.Author: J. Watson
Reviews.Content: The product arrived quickly.  The picture works well.  However the sound wasn't as good as I hoped.  It had a lot of static.

Reviews.Title: Frustrating!!! Picture and Sound Quality Sucks. Waste of $$$
Reviews.Author: Gift Card Recipient "baby mama"
Reviews.Content: My husband ordered this for me to monitor our baby. Too bad the picture is staticky, the sound is horrible, and the battery life majorly SUCKS!  I am very unhappy with this item. It is so frustrating when the picture is staticky and jumpy and the image comes in and out even if you are in the very next room. BIG thumbs down!!Im going to order the baby safe digital video monitor from HOme Sentry instead. I hope i have better luck with it. I'll post a review if i do....

Reviews.Title: phoenix1 serveillance camera
Reviews.Author: Alex Laliberte
Reviews.Content: this camera has nothing i expected.  low quallity monitor bad reception,bad images. not worth setting it up.

Reviews.Title: Security system
Reviews.Author: K-dog
Reviews.Content: Overall, pretty nice system for price.  Battery life and range are weak.  I use it to monitor activities in driveway and backyard.

Reviews.Title: SATISFIED.
Reviews.Author: DENVER
Reviews.Content: I AM USING THIS TO SEE WHO IS COMING TO MY DOOR AND VERY SATISFIED. WE CAN ENJOY COLOR VIEW AND HEAR THE SOUND OUTSIDE.

Reviews.Title: awesome little package
Reviews.Author: cold spring "review"
Reviews.Content: this is not a large scale security camera package. it works great for it's designed purpose. not sure what the negative reviews are about, very happy with mine. my house has a metal roof, which affects the range somewhat. i have a metal shop 150 yards from my house, i can set the camera inside the shop and view from inside my house, though the picture is not great(a lot of snow) you can still make out what you're viewing. highly recommend. great device for reviewing nighttime wildlife activities.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: We purchased the Phoenix1 Defender Video Security system for our new home to use in place of a peep hole for the front door.  We didn't want to drill a hole in our new wood door and have never liked the way peepholes worked anyway.  The Defender works great, we mounted the camera outside above the door and put the monitor inside the entry on the table.  Now, no more guessing, who's at the door, and since we plugged both the camera and monitor into AC, there are no batteries to worry about.

Reviews.Title: Fast and easy
Reviews.Author: betty "The Buyer"
Reviews.Content: Worked within 5 minutes right out of the box.  Great picture upstairs when camera is downstairs.  It will be interesting to see if the night vision lights reflect off the glass since I have the camera inside, pointing outside.  No issues so far.  Picture is very clear.  Sound as well.  Interface is very easy.

Reviews.Title: Works well for the price
Reviews.Author: Daniel G. Rosmarin
Reviews.Content: This has been very useful and worth the sub 150.00 price that I paid.  It gives a clear picture and depending on the lighting, influences the color quality, in a well lit room the color is good.  This is no HD by any means but no worse than a non HD camcorder.  I leave the camera plugged in so I can't attest to the 9V battery life and the monitor will run at least 4 hours on a full charge. The microphone is also very sensitive to noises so I mainly have mine turned down, it easily can pick up voices in another room.I'm very happy with this product so far, its only been a week but I have no complaints.  A zoom or panarama view would be nice like some of the competition but I would still recommend this to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Defender PHOENIX1 Wireless Video Security System with Portable LCD Monitor and Indoor/Outdoor Night Vision Surveillance Camera
Reviews.Author: Gab Ram
Reviews.Content: This product works perfectly well for indoor/outdoor use. It can also be used as a baby monitor. Materials of camera and LCD monitor are very durable. Features are just as described by the vendor and Amazon. It makes your money worth.

Reviews.Title: Defender PHOENIX1 Wireless Video Security System
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: I had this up and running within 5 or 10 minutes after taking it from it's box. Inside, the picture is almost perfect. Outside is another story. The display looses it color in bright sunlight and is very 'snowy'. Still it is very acceptable for my purposes. I do wish it had an easy way to record or to interface with a computer.I connected it to a small TV I hadn't been using. The 8" screen is an improvement over the smaller screen of the receiver. Although I think I will appreciate the portability of the hand held unit.As the sun was going down, the colors improved significantly but the 'snow' continued. After dark the streetlights added 'hot spots' to the image. There, even darker, the color remained.So far, I like what I see and by experimenting for the best placement for the cam and with the sensitivity, I think it will do fine. I'm already considering adding another cam.

Reviews.Title: Esy to use
Reviews.Author: Gary R. Smith
Reviews.Content: The camera was easy to set up and use. I did not have any problems in getting the device up and running.

Reviews.Title: Using it for a baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Worried Mommy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I bought this when our baby turned 6 months old because he was starting to roll over and not sleep on his back anymore.  I was very worried about SIDS so we wanted to be able to see him without waking him up.  We really like the Defender because it has night vision and sound.  I like the holster to charge it in, we just leave it next to our bed.  We have had a lot of static issues with it however, and just two rooms away the alarm starts to go off.  I like the alarm when it sounds in the night because we are sure to wake up if he starts to fuss, but during the day when he is just fussing and doesn't want to go to sleep I wish there was a way to clear the alarm and just listen at leisure.  Unfortunately you can only turn the sensitivity down a little.  The only other thing I wish it had was a belt loop holster.  Other than those few minor things we LOVE it!!!  Its so easy to hook up and use!

Reviews.Title: its okay
Reviews.Author: TrustNoone
Reviews.Content: i bought it for a baby monitor since most had bad reviews, so i got this one since i can also use it as a security camerapros: it works pretty good; compact; mic on camera; battery operated and can be plugged in; batter saver: screen can be turned off but will alarm(beep) if noise is picked upcons: its pretty expensive(150) for the range IMO; no speaker on camera to talk back (front door: who is it?)cant walk outside of house, picture becomes to staticits okay for a baby monitor and to see who's outside of your front door;

Reviews.Title: If used in open space, Ok !!!
Reviews.Author: Joao Povoa
Reviews.Content: In open spaces it is Ok, but in closed it take "noise"...In my case works very good.Nice product with some limits...

Reviews.Title: Not really for outdoors
Reviews.Author: Don R.
Reviews.Content: The range is good and the video image quality is sufficient, but connecting it to a 9 volt battery is a joke. It lasts for an few hours at most. So connecting it outside is just about impossible unless you live in a really dry area where you could plug it in to an outside outlet. The AC adapter that comes with it is certainly not weather proof.If you are looking purely for an indoor camera to monitor a room (baby, kids, etc.), this would work OK. I suppose it would work OK to monitor your pool or something like that outside if you could plug it in someplace away from weather and water.I purchased two cameras wanting to monitor my front door and driveway. I have one aimed through a window near my front door. This works fine during the day, but at night the "night vision" reflects off the glass so I get no image. The other I was able to rig looking through a bedroom window towards my driveway, which is a well lit outside area. This one works pretty well even at night, but it doesn't cover my front door, which is what I really wanted. I had to move this second camera a good distance from the window so the night vision wouldn't reflect back.I do think the manufacturer is being very deceptive when they call this an "Outdoor Surveillance Camera". Sure, it will work outside with a 9 volt battery, but you would need to change the battery every few hours, which is not at all practice. If you are good with electronics you might be able to rig this some way to actually work outside.

Reviews.Title: just my luck to make the wurst possilble choice!
Reviews.Author: Kid Icarus "The Lad from Hades"
Reviews.Content: though the camera(when absoultely no interference or cell phone activity is present and it always is when you need it most!) is decent enough day or night, the unit itself cannot hook to anything, you cannot record your videos when odd occurences come up and I'm not there, I'd like it recorded the unit comes with an A/V out/ male to RCA female but it doesn't work in a TV the out jack, not the cord is at fault but it is totally useless except for monitoring current activity.  I've got better things to do(like clean the toilet or watch grass grow) than play "security guard" at my abode.
